website_summaries.verdict: Few other shoes truly embody the real minimalist kind of running the way the Vibram Five Fingers Bikila does. Obviously, it does not have any kind of arch support as it is extremely light and flexible. It naturally shines where natural running and barefoot experiences are involved. It is simply one of the best minimalist shoes a runner can ever find.
pros: The traction is just superb, according to the same experts
Sufficient protection is available for the truly minimalist runner
The Five Fingers Bikila literally fits like a sock
Minimalist runners will find it incredibly comfortable
cons: Not ideal for other types of runners
Some runners preferred better cushioning in this shoe

customer_reviews.title: BEST shoe to wear/ WORST shoe to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoe but, like any fabric lined slipper worn w/o socks, it will need cleaning and 'refreshing' at some point. Manufacture's care guidelines didn't work (damp wipe) and you can't toss this wonderful - and expensive! - slipper into the wash or dishwasher. I did manage to get mine clean & dry & oder free free with Dawn dishwashing liquid, clean damp cloth, kitchen brush, paper towels and a hand vac. Here's a picture of mine with 1 clean and 1 before cleaning. Happy to share details of process if anyone is interested.
customer_reviews.author: debshops2

customer_reviews.title: Heel fabric worn through after only 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Falling apart after 6 weeks. I have worn these around the house for approximately 6 weeks and the fabric at the heels has already worn through. Very disappointed, especially given how much I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worn out--fabric gone off footbed in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I love these slippers---BUT after 3 months of wear the fabric has completely rubbed off the footbed. I love the support they give but very disappointed in the quality. I buy almost exclusive Vionic shoes and it seems quality has gone down significantly after they bought out Orthaheel. Slippers that are this expensive should last longer than 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Trudy

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out
customer_reviews.text: These are cute shoes. I bought Vionic for the arch support and comfort typical of Vionics. I'm wearing these around the house to test them out. The buckle on the right that can be used to tighten or loosen the shoe may be a problem. After a short time walking in the house I'm aware of the buckle, and not in a good way. The toe strap is not that comfortable but I think after wearing a few times it may be okay. I don't know yet if these are going to work out given the irritations felt so far. I'll update after giving them more time.
customer_reviews.author: M.E.

customer_reviews.title: these are great; and that's why I spent so much money ...
customer_reviews.text: As far as arch support, these are great; and that's why I spent so much money on house slippers. But the insole is threadbare in less than 9 months. I take very good care of my footwear and I'm more than surprised that these shoes did not last. The fabric on the outside of the slipper is fine, the velcro is fine, the arch support is good, but I can't wear them anymore now that the insole of the shoe is threadbare. I had planned to buy a second pair for myself, and a pair for my mother, but now I'll have to search high and low for a similar slipper that will hold up longer. :(
customer_reviews.author: wildeflower

customer_reviews.title: Such a great shoe! In love
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these shoes! I can wear them all day long and my arches don't hurt at all. I'm younger so the fact that these shoes don't look like old lady shoes, but still have the support I need is awesome! Thank you Vionic for making such a cute and functional shoe! These are a great summer shoe! Fair warning, the first time you happen to wear these in the rain, the foot bed can get a little slippery. Fit is perfect too!
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 pairs of Vionics. I love them. These are so-so. The Velcro on the,straps was sewn too close to the edge and scratched my foot. I was too lazy to return. I fixed it by applying a,self stick adhesive moleskin patch to cover the Velcro. Annoying as they were expensive. I will wear them a few months and get my money's worth, but would not buy again. I still ended up having to wear them with socks as to be more comfortable, which defeats the purpose of open toed slippers for summer.
customer_reviews.author: JK in LA

customer_reviews.title: Great supportive yet cute sandal
customer_reviews.text: this shoe easily slips off and on and can be adjusted to fit your foot with the buckle. I'm not crazy about patent leather but it's not too shiny, which is good. Great support and the size 9 fit my size 9 foot perfectly. My foot is thin so I tightened the shoe to the first notch, to make it fit perfectly snug.
customer_reviews.author: MScott

customer_reviews.title: now that I have had these shoes a while I am not happy with them and I would not recommend them
customer_reviews.text: Update, now that I have had these shoes a while I am not happy with them and I would not recommend them. They just wear out too soon. The foot rest is so thin and thread bare, just totally uncomfortable and a total waste of money. I have no money to waste, so I am unhappy! BUT the Vionic sandals I bought are good quality and worth the money, they feel good and I have worn them inside all winter in Syracuse, just because they make my feet not hurt while wearing. I keep them beside my bed and step into them when I wake up. Go for the sandals and skip their fuzzy slippers.
customer_reviews.author: Robin M. Doolittle

customer_reviews.title: Very hard footbed, weird material
customer_reviews.text: The description says this slipper has a memory foam footbed. If it does it's the hardest memory foam I've ever felt. To me, memory foam should have enough give to conform to your foot but be firm enough not to collapse. This was so hard, not only didn't it conform to my foot it actually hurt my feet. In addition, the fuzzy material the slipper was made of was like a cheap plush toy. I can't imagine this would stand up through one washing. This was my first experience with this brand and there won't be a second one. These are going back.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Good arch support slippers
customer_reviews.text: Podiatrist told me to stop being barefoot in the house so I bought these. I love the support they give and I’ve washed them several times in my front load washer on delicate with no issues. I gave three stars because the design has the Velcro seam rubbing right on the top of my foot where I have some veins that are sensitive. I had to loosen the straps and wear them fairly loose and floppy which is annoying, but they are supporting my feet which is what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: ZRanch

customer_reviews.title: Odd Noise
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Vionic slippers. They are the most comfortable things I've put on my feet for the last six years, especially given my plantar fasciitis, so I won't buy another brand. However, this is the first time the slippers have crackled when I've walked. I thought at first they were sticking to the floor, but the sound seems to be coming from inside the slipper. I'm hoping the noise just goes away. Also, I was surprised to find that the only color I could buy in size 7 was tiger stripes. I would have preferred a solid, but so it goes.
customer_reviews.author: LSP

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, except the buckle
customer_reviews.text: Even though I sent these shoes back, they fit great with awesome support. The problem was that the buckle on the side touched my skin. When metal touches my skin I break out, so I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Hard to break in, blisters between toes
customer_reviews.text: I've had these several months now and I've barely worn them because I get a blister between my toes every time I do. The shiny pleather is a bit stiff and causes too much friction. I've tried adjusting the side buckle to be looser or tighter to see if that helped, but no matter what they rub too much. I love my Vionic flip-flops, which took almost no time to break in, and the arch support in these seems a bit lower than those. This is a negative for me but may be a positive for others looking for a lower arch support.
customer_reviews.author: ezaire75

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe, bottom collects dirt
customer_reviews.text: Great house slipper. It provides excellent support for someone who has a little arch in their feet. The only issue with this shoe is that it picks up everything in your house and then redeposits it around so you have to occasionally clean the bottom of the shoe to get all of the fuzz or animal hair off. Otherwise, you’ll start to find little patches of fuzz and what not in random places on your floors. This is pretty annoying, but since this is the most comfortable shoe I found for my foot, I put up with it.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Too hard and uncomfortable arch
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a soft and comfortable slipper. Like the other negative reviews have stated, they are rock hard. The arch is also way too high, I feel like I have a ball under both of my arches. The pain in my heel is gone but now I have pain in my arches, lol. Since I work at home, I was hoping I could use these and stand while I work. That's NOT happening with these shoes. Back to the crocs I go until I can find a better alternative. I've only had them for a day but they're heading back tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie R-Li

customer_reviews.title: Great for those with foot issues or not!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought these were tight around the top but it was because I'm not used to wearing shoes of this style and probably over-tightened because I was worried they'd come off. I have multiple foot issues and these are very helpful. Those with no or little arch will find the arch uncomfortable if you don't wear shoes with good arch support now, but it took mere hours for me to adjust fully and be super comfy. I can't over-emphasize how highly I recommend these slippers. One further comment: They do add about an inch to my height, if that would be of concern for you.
customer_reviews.author: ButterflyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Too much arch support for me, and too loose.
customer_reviews.text: These are very pretty sandals and the quality is obvious! They fit just wasn’t right for my feet. At first, they felt very wide and loose, but after using the tightest buckling, I could walk comfortably, EXCEPT the arch support was too high and firm for my feet. It felt like walking on a “lump” in my shoe. I’m sure they would be perfect for those needing that much support.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Flutist

customer_reviews.title: Heel cushion wears out fast
customer_reviews.text: This slipper was just right for me when new in September of last year. My only complaint then was that it shed a lot of fluff. Six months later, the cushion on the heel had compressed down to nothing and, I didn't realize then, causing my heel to hurt. The pain was so much that I required injections on both feet. I went on a trip and left them behind. When I returned and used them again, pain developed once more. Now I am convinced that the cushion is worn out and I am walking on a hard surface when I were these slippers. Great concept, poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: Nuria from Guate

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support but heavy on feet
customer_reviews.text: These have excellent arch support and the straps are Velcro so you can adjust to the width of your foot. I normally wear a 7.5 wide and I ordered a 7. It fits great. The biggest downfall of these slippers is that they are heavy. These are great if you’re not walking around the house too much. If you are cleaning and walking a lot, they are just too heavy. The tops of my feet start to hurt from the weight of the slippers. I still gave 4 stars due to the excellent arch support. It would be nice if these were more lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: AGYG

customer_reviews.title: I have lived these slippers for years.
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth pair of these same slippers. I replace them about every two years. And I wear them everyday. I have a foot problem that causes my foot to hurt if I walk barefoot. These slippers are just as comfortable as my sneakers and custom made orthotics. I love the high arch and the sturdy feel of these slippers. The only negative is the high price but I’ve found that in footwear, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: joannetk

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment for PF and shock absorbing heel cup
customer_reviews.text: Make the investment and buy these for plantar fasciitis, shock absorbing heel support. It has made a huge difference in recovery and I take these everywhere I travel so I can have the support needed when having to walk on hard floor. Usually 8-8.5 in sandals and went with 8 for this one.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little large, but great for aching feet!
customer_reviews.text: These are clodhoppery-looking, a little slippery in the footbed and a tad stiff-soled when walking, but they are the most COMFORTABLE things I've ever put on my feet! The footbed conformed immediately to every curve in my feet, and support my high arch perfectly. My feet are in good shape, but at 71 they are becoming a little stiff and achey. The aches are considerably reduced when I wear these religiously at home. I typically wear between 8.5 and 9, but the size 8 was perfect. Size 8 dimensions are 10.5 inches long, by 4.25 inches at the ball of the foot, if that helps anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wore these around the house for 2 hours and decided to return them. They were not comfortable, and no matter how tight I tighten the straps, my foot still slid around inside the slipper. I have wide feet in this should not happen. Also the terry cloth was very hot. I wanted these for summer and did not want my feet to feel hot. Also the footbed was supportive but very hard. Not very comfortable. Don't recommend this slipper
customer_reviews.author: psychetri

customer_reviews.title: If u have PF this works ❣️
customer_reviews.text: With my PF I must wear slippers around the house!!️ (Don't wear outside to keep carpets clean). I tried other brands, but gave them away. This one works BEST for support and comfort. Doesn't crowd my toes. Easy to slip on at night for a trip to the bathroom. Of course I hesitated on the price, and knowing they will need to be replaced if too dirty or worn, BUT it will be my "forever" ❤️ Brand of slipper.
customer_reviews.author: MaryBeth

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd Pair
customer_reviews.text: I love these slippers. Even tho they are open toe, my feet are always warm in them. I've had plantar fasciitis in the past and these slippers give me the arch support and stable foot bed I need. As long as they keep making these, I will keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: JudyH

customer_reviews.title: Good arch support
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because I've started to experience discomfort from my regular Ugg slippers due to over pronation and flat arches. It's been about a week so far of wearing every evening after getting home from work as well as in the mornings when getting ready, and so far I'm pleased with the support provided. I'm a fan of the indoor/outdoor soles and slip on style so I can quickly take our dog outside without having to fuss with sneakers. After having grown accustomed to sheepskin lined slippers, I'm underwhelmed by this pair's polar fleece construction and agree with previous reviewers the material is likely to wear out long before the rest of the slipper.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Garnett

customer_reviews.title: I'm a man, these are the greatest shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: I had to use my wife's pair to go down the hall over vacation, and I couldn't believe how good they felt. I looked high and far for the men's version, but I don't think they make them for men, so I just bought the women's shoe, and couldn't be happier. I'm 60 years old and 250 lbs, with a size 10.5 wide. Absolutely no complaints, and I could care less if someone wants to know why I'm wearing women's slippers.
customer_reviews.author: william mcvay

customer_reviews.title: Love this sandal
customer_reviews.text: I have to wear arch supports and probably own more than 30 pair of Vionics. While on a trip, the black flip flops I was wearing just wore out (not Vionics) and as I was leaving on another trip within a week, I ordered these. They are cute, comfortable and fit securely because of the placement of the strap. I just love them.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J.

customer_reviews.title: Buy these if you can stand velcro scratching the top of your foot
customer_reviews.text: I have to have something NOW so I’m determined to make these work. They were very uncomfortable for 8 hours or so until they began to form somewhat to my foot. I would never ever recommend them to anyone unless you can improve them on your sewing machine (like I did) or want to take them to a shoe repair shop. The Velcro on the top strap is sewn securely through both layers. The piece on the bottom is only sewn to one layer. When you slide your foot in, the velcro rolls, constantly scratching the top of your foot. It is supposed to be designed by podiatrists. Well, they sold the idea to a very cheap production company.
customer_reviews.author: diana

customer_reviews.title: Best slippers anywhere...
customer_reviews.text: These are my third pair of Vionic slippers and the only brand I would buy. Comfort and looks good. I noticed in other reviews people didn't think you could machine wash these slippers...I haven't washed this pair yet but my other two pairs have been machine washed many, many times, toss into the dryer for a short time then finish drying in the sun, they come out perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Suziequtes

customer_reviews.title: High quality - Great fit!
customer_reviews.text: These are just what I have been looking for. They have a little height (I don't like a flat slipper). It definitely has a solid arch support (not like any other slippers) so you can really walk and stand around in them. Excellent quality. They fit as expected and also have an adjustable strap on the top. If you have any feet issues - these are the slippers for you. Worth the extra money!!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Donehue

customer_reviews.title: Too High, Hard Arch Detracts from an otherwise well made slipper
customer_reviews.text: As a satisfied Vionic sneaker owner, I was pleased to order these Vionic slippers to replace the wide width, cushioned "Cirrus" slippers that are no longer available and likely discontinued. Please note: Pros: Not wide width but cut full enough with cushioned, adjustable flaps Soft, cushioned sole and well made, non skid bottom soles Cons Arch is so high it propels my foot forward through the front of the shoe Arch material is hard, rather than firm and therefore painful I will not be wearing these slippers due to the overly high, hard arch.
customer_reviews.author: At The Movies

customer_reviews.title: Covid 19 means slippers all day long for me.
customer_reviews.text: In these days of Covid 19 many of us spend a lot of time in slippers. These are very comfortable. The texture is not too hot for summer because of the open toes. I am living in them at this point. My feet were hurting before and now they don't. My right foot seems to slip forward a bit but that probably has more to do with my feet than the slippers. I have had pretty good luck with Vionics. It's tricky ordering shoes over the internet, but I am more likely to be successful with Vionics. They are true to size.
customer_reviews.author: Carol C

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable straight out of box.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Vionic sandals they are the only flip flop style I wear. These fit as expected and I wore them all day walking around Key West, FL, no breaking period. The patent leather raised them from beach flops to casual dress wear, I wore them with shorts and dresses. The suede-like footbed was marvelous with good arch support, a concern of mine since I am prone to plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: DebOld

customer_reviews.title: Wears out, didn't work for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear indoors because I have plantar fasciitis. Initially the slippers felt comfortable, but after wearing them for a few months I felt the arch support flattened out and they became no better than regular slippers. Also they shed like crazy and left black lint all over the house carpet every time I wore them. I also found the velcro scratched the top of my foot. I ended up replacing them with Hoka One Recovery Slides which are amazing for my plantar fasciitis (supporting and stretch the plantar fascia when I wear them) and don't leave lint.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: The best slipper for  Plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time to purchase these slippers. I suffer from Plantar fascitis and recently had a flare up. I had purchased a pair a few years ago and wore them out. The minute I got home from work, I put them on and wore them around the house. They are soft and I love the adjustable strap across the toes so I can customize for best fit. They lasted a long time, but eventually I had to discard them, plus my feet had gotten better. I have recently had a flare up and purchased another pair. They provide the support and relief that I need. I love Vionics and have even purchased their flip flops too.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie Beach

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable; velcro doesn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time in 1 year I have bought this pair since it's extremely comfortable. My first pair became unsafe to use because the velcro reached end of life and stopped holding together. I almost feel again because of that. I wish they make longer laying velcros on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dhruv

customer_reviews.title: Post ankle surgery
customer_reviews.text: Not a traditional slipper in that the sole is very hard. The fabric is soft and pleasing though. The main thing is that it has made a big positive difference for me. I used to get up from bed or couch and really limp stiffly for some distance. This slipper allows me to walk almost normally from the get go and then regain my usual gait quickly. If I don't get back into my regular shoes when the swelling is down I will try other Vionics.
customer_reviews.author: Sus

customer_reviews.title: Hard sole but loose on the sides
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and needed a sturdy sole on my slipper for around the house and occasionally stepping outside. I really love the hard sole support for my feet as well as the arch support. As with any slipper the sides are soft fabric as well as the bottom, so my feet slip a little from side to side when I walk and it you are doing any type of climbing, your feet will not stay in straight. Overall I am pleased with the slipper and would probably but it again.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Very happy and would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: It was delivered quickly ahead of schedule. The product is just as described. I haven’t had them off my feet since I receive them. You know, because it’s Covid at home time! Gives me great support. was previously recommended by podiatrist/Surgeon.Very happy and would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Moosekiss

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Ah!!! These are the most comfortable pair of hours shoes! I love the arch support, soft cushion feel, the way the strap can be adjusted across the top of my foot and the sole is a great height. I suffer with plantar fasciitis, so I am not supposed to walk barefoot. I had been wearing a flat pair of house shoes and decided to give these a try. I was hesitant about spending that much money for a pair of house shoes, but I am so glad I did!!! If these came in every day shoes, I'd buy them in a heartbeat in every color!
customer_reviews.author: Teacher3

customer_reviews.title: Great support they relieved my backache problems quite a bit
customer_reviews.text: Great support, they relieved my backache problems quite a bit. The pain left almost completely, I had to wear them around the house for a day or two, just as suggested. They have to be wiped clean with plain water, however, I can easily overlook that, simply because of the good fit and pain reducing feature in this shoe. Also, they have an anti-bacterial foot bed. Some of the other reviewers said that they had indeed put these shoes in the washer with no problems. I might consider that, but I would hesitate to put them in the dryer. I have already ordered another pair. I plan to have a complete wardrobe of these wonderful shoes
customer_reviews.author: Pollyanna

customer_reviews.title: Demonic slippers
customer_reviews.text: Worst shoes ever! Wore them twice and I got a excruciating lump the size of a golf ball atop my right foot. No idea why. Thought it was maybe a fluke, but I scared to wear them again. I put them aside for a few months and tried again and it did the same thing. A ridiculous amount of wasted money to earn yet another excruciating lump atop my foot the likes of which no other footwear has ever given me. I’d recommend these to my worst enemy. Horrific shoes. Company wouldn’t give me a refund because the 30 day window passed.
customer_reviews.author: Hyegal

customer_reviews.title: Can't go without these slippers.
customer_reviews.text: I have to have these slippers on hard floors. They provide great arch support and comfort. Worth every penny! I am usually a 9 1/2- 10 and I order 9's and they fit perfectly, so I'd say they run just a tad big. This is my 3rd pair in about 10 years, so they do last.
customer_reviews.author: SAW

customer_reviews.title: Supportive and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love these slippers! After having plantar fasciitis for several years, I've switched over to using Vionic shoes almost exclusively. I noticed that walking around the house barefoot was starting to hurt my feet, especially after having surgery to correct my plantar fasciitis. These slippers have been amazing! They provide just enough arch support and are so soft. The sole is close enough to a real shoe that my feet don't slide around on the floor. I'd definitely recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie O.

customer_reviews.title: Glorious Instant Relief From Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Just got diagnosed with plantar fasciitis in both feet from standing too long unpacking moving boxes on new tile floors. Ordered these babies Prime, and stepped into instant relief! They are correctly sized lengthwise and the width is adjustable with Velcro. Super soft lining, and feel like I'm walking on a cloud. Quickly order another pair in black so I can switch off to match my bathrobes. Fabulous slippers!
customer_reviews.author: Livin' The Dream in RSF

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Washable
customer_reviews.text: I hate to pay this much for slippers, but they help my plantar fascitis heal, so I bite the bullet. This is my second pair. When souled I throw them in the washing machine then air dry. My first pair is over 2 years old and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Your aching feet will thank you!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for anyone suffering/struggling from Plantar Fasciitis or those who would just like a pair of slipper/shoes that offer proper arch support. Lightly padded with a soft, washable fabric, they provide my feet with instant relief. (Seriously. If I've had to be on my feet for hours and haven't worn them, I slip them on and say, "Ahh") I have them in a number of colors. Once I discovered how great they were, I knew I'd never be without them. Footsmart used to carry them, but for some reason it appears they've stopped, so I was thrilled to find them here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sheehy

customer_reviews.title: Vionic shoes are outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Vionic shoes for several years now after having plantar fasciitis. They are absolutely the best shoes for me. I know that not everyone can wear them, but they are fantastic for support. I have not tried the slippers until now, but am so excited about these shoes. They fit perfectly with lots of arch support and will be my new "house" shoes this fall and winter. They look great and I can't wait to wear them!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes!  They Have Arch Support!
customer_reviews.text: I suppose these are expensive for slippers, but they're worth every penny. I'm recovering from plantar fascitis and under doctor's orders I'm to wear arch support even at home in order to keep it from returning. Tried Isotoners, and found that the Memory foam simply does not offer arch support. These have good sturdy arch support and are warm and comfy at the same time. Adjustable Velcro means they fit well even when you're wearing heavy socks. Highly recommended....
customer_reviews.author: Emmi331Top Contributor: Jigsaw Puzzles

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: So happy I invested in these great slippers. No more cheap throw away slippers again. I have a narrow foot. Within hours cheap slippers stretch out and my foot slides through the toes. These slippers are by specific shoe SIZE, not range. Can not recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great Support
customer_reviews.text: My mother uses these slippers and appreciates the orthotic support. Her mobility is compromised and these are the only slippers that keep her steady and provide support. They run true to size and can be adjusted across the top. She has a very narrow foot and the slipper can be adjusted for that, but sometimes her feet swell and the slipper can still fit comfortably...the velcro is very strong. She machine washes them, but does not put in the dryer....they hold up for years. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Torn skin off toes
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE Vionic shoes usually and was so excited to order these for a cruise--- worn the first day and the toe thong ribbon/leather rubbed the skin off my toes to the point that I was left with no skin and was bleeding badly after a few hours. I was so disappointed-- and left with no shoes on a cruise ship!! I was shocked at how badly these fit and how they hurt so bad!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I have several pairs of Vionic's and this is the first time I've had something fall apart. I received my slippers on April 25, 2019 and the right slipper started splitting at the beginning of July 2019 and as of Jul 26, 2019 there is a large hole (see picture). This item should certainly not be falling apart 2.5 months after purchase especially since I don't ever wear them everyday. It's hot and I've been wearing my Vionic flip flops most of the time. I'm bummed because I really needed a pair of slippers but I simply cannot recommend these slippers.
customer_reviews.author: Jaztam

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes, just not for my feet
customer_reviews.text: I like these slippers a lot!!! they are very soft and comfortable. The sole allows for stepping outside if need be. My problem is with my feet. I have one that is narrow and one that is too wide due to some extraordinary foot problems and when the one foot is swelled, as it gets every day, these slippers will not fit. They are going to be really great for someone with normal feet. They are pricey to a degree, but for me worth the money had they fit right. So I can highly recommend. They are just not for me.
customer_reviews.author: jliveusa

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement pair, as my puppy also enjoyed my slippers as much as I had. These are a nice color. At first they are tight, so I have to loosen them (I also have wide feet), but after wearing for a couple of days, then I tighten up the velcro. Provide great arch support. If you have never worn the Vionic slippers before, caution to not wear the first day the entire day and be doing things inside, your feet may hurt. After a day of work, I can't wait to put my slippers on. And my puppy also likes them!
customer_reviews.author: L. S.

customer_reviews.title: quality slippers
customer_reviews.text: The slippers are adjustable and fit very well. I have serious hammertoes so that design really works for me. The support feels secure. Overall I really like them. Because of the balls of my feet are in need of care, I still have to cut out foam insoles but that is not the shoes' fault, haha. Well done slippers.
customer_reviews.author: olbat

customer_reviews.title: Great for those with flat feet
customer_reviews.text: I have become flat-footed over the years, and these slippers are very supportive as I go about my daily indoor activities. They are a bit heavier than I would like, and cost more than I would ideally like to pay, but that is the trade-off for the support they offer. I usually go through two pair in a year as I get a lot of wear in the toe area (maybe due to hammer toes). I tried another similar brand that was less expensive but the quality was not as good so I am back to buying these.
customer_reviews.author: MLD

customer_reviews.title: Great support yet soft and cozy.
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida and I run around barefoot very frequently however, on occasion I have paid a price for this practice by suffering from a roaring case of plantar fasciitis. These slippers offer solid support as well as being soft and snuggly without my feet being too warm down here in the sunshine state. I think they are the perfect choice for me. The only reason they did not get 5 stars is because I have not owned them long enough to see how well they wear over time. I recommend these slippers for those who want strong support without roasting your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Ann Evans

customer_reviews.title: Awful for the spinal column
customer_reviews.text: These turned out to be awful for my body, can’t really just wear them around the house because they threw off my entire spinal column. The issue is they make your feet pronate outwards and they have such a heel that it’s not good for anybody’s back.
customer_reviews.author: WhenAllAreOne&OneIsAll

customer_reviews.title: Ultra soft but firm support
customer_reviews.text: These are BY FAR the best slippers I've ever owned. I have extra wide problem feet and these slippers not only cradle my feet with softness but are firm support for my high arches. They are more than just slippers...they are like orthopedic shoes made just for me! These are my second pair in 7 years. Washable, durable and soft as bunny fur! Buy them! You will not regret it!!
customer_reviews.author: Aunty Carla

customer_reviews.title: These are the best shoes to wear in the house
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair for myself and my mom and we both love them. We both have high arches and foot pain and these are the best slippers I have ever owned. They give me support while I'm standing doing my house chores and they are durable enough if you have to step out side. I really like them and glad I didn't get the knock version I started to buy.
customer_reviews.author: H. R.

customer_reviews.title: Good arch support
customer_reviews.text: I like the arch support on these slippers. I ordered a pair of this brand of shoes and the arch support wasn't as good as the slippers. However these slippers are a little heavy and the fabric makes your feet slip a bit, so you need to be careful going up and down stairs. Also they were just a bit long, but not bad enough to exchange. They help my knee pain quite a bit. They would be better if they were made with an ankle strap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good - but pricey for not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable. There is a strong supportive sole. The memory foam quickly formed to the shape of my foot though and it’s already permanently imprinted and I have used them less than a month. I don’t expect my foot to grow or change being an adult, so it’s probably not that big of a deal. I wish there was a little more give in the top fabric though sometimes I have to loosen the Velcro to not feel uncomfortable tightness when walking/bending my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Milinazzo

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful for bad arches
customer_reviews.text: These slippers are wonderful because they adjust to the width of your foot by means of a velcro closure. They are slip resistant on floors. Once you adjust to the arch support they provide, they are very comfortable. There are quite a few colors to choose from, although sometimes some of the popular colors may not be available in the size you need when you try to place an order.
customer_reviews.author: susieque440

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all and the too expensive......
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair of Vionic slippers, black and white plaid mules and they were wonderful for my feet and helped my plantar fasciitis. I wanted an open toe slipper that for warmer weather and was excited that Vionic offered these. There is very little support, if any, with these slippers. In addition the adjustable Velcro on the top of the foot does not provide a snug fit. My feet kept sliding forward. Too much money for a slipper that does not fit correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L. Woodstuff

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair, not as supportive as 1st pair purchased 2 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 94 year old mom, this is the 2nd pair, she told me these never had the same support as the first pair. Said they didn’t seem to be made as well as the first, less support
customer_reviews.author: petsitter/ cat toy inventor

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, I’ve been wearing them a couple of days for short periods of time, and for me, they aren’t that comfortable. On the left foot, the sole seems to rub my baby toe a bit. They fit good though. The arch for me isn’t comfortable either. I guess I need to break them in but I’ve never had to break in ortho slippers before. I’m disappointed as they weren’t cheap. I’ve tried to wear them and have them get comfy so now, they may sit in closet. They seem well made, easy on off, adjustable strap.
customer_reviews.author: bonita hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome support and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I got these slippers to replace my very old Acorn slippers. I was looking for something suitable for warm weather (no mules or otherwise closed toe slippers), along with great arch support. Based on the description and a single review at the time, I went for it. They are FANTASTIC!! Very soft and the support is amazing. I have a relatively high arch and often buy Dansko shoes for their excellent arch support. These are like Dansko's but in slipper form! My new favorite slippers.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ryder

customer_reviews.title: scratchy velcro
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of vionic house slippers, I usually love them and wear them to death so I ordered a new pair. The velcro attachment is way off on the left pair, so the scratchy velcro pokes at the top of my foot. It's been awful , but my son wore them out so now they are dirty so I cannot return them. But I am very disappointed at how the velcro patch is too close to the edge instead of being in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: mluna

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoors and out -- comfy  sandal/slipper with Vionic arch support
customer_reviews.text: I bought the leopard print version and wear them all the time at home. Even started wearing them "out" as "sandals" when I forgot to take them off one day (they were so comfortable). I got the black pair so I could have a "formal" version for wearing out of the house whenever needed. These are my new summer sandals, even though the fabric is soft and warm in winter. Better for me with Vionic footbed than Birkenstocks, which look similar!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Schiffman

customer_reviews.title: get worn out fast.
customer_reviews.text: These slippers have been amazing for my plantar fasciitis! I can't walk without them, it hurts too bad. I really wanted to give these slippers 5 stars because I really do love them. But I have had to buy 2 pairs in the past 2 years. They don't even last one year before the sole starts to rip and the strap gets stretched out and eventually I can't keep them on. even with the adjustable velcro. I HAVE to wear these every day when I'm not wearing tennis shoes, so I need something that is durable and will last. For this price, its just not worth it. I can't afford to buy $60 slippers every 10 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amy123

customer_reviews.title: Was pleased to find house shoes with them built in
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis and wear orthotic inserts with all of my shoes. Unfortunately, I must wear my shoes all of the time, even when I am at home. Was pleased to find house shoes with them built in, especially ones that had such positive reviews. How disappointing, these are the most uncomfortable shoes I have ever worn! They have caused my pain to flair up again, requiring me to go back on my anti inflammatory medication. After a day or 2 of not wearing these, the pain is gone! I will NEVER purchase Orthoheel again!!
customer_reviews.author: Pam B

customer_reviews.title: BEST Slippers for PF!
customer_reviews.text: These. Slippers. Are. A. Godsend. If you suffer from pf or other foot pain relating to your arch, these are the solution for you. I have very wide feet and the adjustable strap across the top allows for me to wear them even on days of swelling. Highly recommend. My last pair lasted me almost 5 years before I finally decided to replace them because the fabric had worn out. These are worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: slythrn_barnbum

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have the closed toe Vionic slippers and love them. I thought that for the summer I could just wear a good pair of flip flops. After about a week the bottom of my feet started to hurt and felt like I was walking on bare bone. When I saw that they carried the open toe Vionic slippers I was pleased and ordered. Almost instantly the discomfort/pain is gone. They are so worth the price... Love them and I am going to order more for spares.
customer_reviews.author: Gailsey

customer_reviews.title: Not as cushy as I'd hoped...
customer_reviews.text: I just received them. I wear a size 9 closed toe shoe and an an 8 1/2 in sandals. I got the slippers in a 9 and they fit fine. I was expecting to have more cush to them when I walk on my tile floor. but they are pretty firm. but if it helps with the plantar fasciitist and the recovery of a sprained foot, then I'll be happy. They are ridiculously ugly though and make my size 9 feet look like size 12! But I don't care. I just want to be able to walk on my tile floor without pain. I will update my review in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Laura C

customer_reviews.title: Keep feet healthy when lounging
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair and I would have given it 5 stars if the Velcro had not scratched my foot, that’s never happened before. I needed them desperately so I held on to them, I’ll have to come up with a solution other then to put on socks. I’ve always appreciated having a slipper with an arch and one where you can adjust the width to give the proper support.
customer_reviews.author: Conscious Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I gave these as a gift and I haven't asked the recipient all the above questions. She did have a pair of these in the past and loved them so it will be interesting if they are the same as the other ones as there has been times that you order the same shoe, style, size etc. and the quality or fit isn't the same.
customer_reviews.author: sadie

customer_reviews.title: Vionic Women's Relax Slipper
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in the same size as my Vionic sandals and they fit well. The velcro allows for adjustment to fit your own feet. (I wear a size larger in Vionic closed toe shoes). I appreciate having the arch support while walking around the house. I haven't had them long enough to say how they will wear, but so far I would not hesitate to order them again.
customer_reviews.author: Char and Pete

customer_reviews.title: Nice Orthopedic House Slippers
customer_reviews.text: I hope they come out with a similar slipper in a smoother, more durable fabric or a soft leather. I am not a big lover of the fuzzy fabric but it is soft and feels comfy. I would not describe this as a "terry" fabric at all. The sandal style slippers are adjustable for width. I ordered my usual size and they were plenty long. I liked mine so much that I bought a pair for a friend's birthday gift since she like the orthotic foot bed too.
customer_reviews.author: FLBoater

customer_reviews.title: Velcro is rubbing on my foot and it’s irritating
customer_reviews.text: I would return the item, but it would be thrown out and that’s wasteful. It was an expensive purchase. The Velcro that makes it possible to adjust the width, is poorly sewn on. It rubs on the top of my foot and is very irritating. So I need to always wear socks to protect my skin. Shouldn’t have to.
customer_reviews.author: ABLP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and helps
customer_reviews.text: Our house is all hardwood so I needed something to give my feet support. I like that the velcro strap is adjustable to the width of your foot. The support is perfect to fight foot and leg fatigue. Since wearing these as "house slippers", my feet and back pain has subsided. The material is soft and comfy, but I will say that on the warmer days they can get a little warm.
customer_reviews.author: Sara B.

customer_reviews.title: Fabric on footbed wears away leaving a hard shell arch support shell
customer_reviews.text: At first blush, these slippers have better than average support, and are very comfortable. BUT in about 4-6 weeks of wear, the "fluffy" fabric on the sole wears away leaving a hard shell (the arch support). That hard shell caused abrasions on my foot so I could no longer wear these slippers. Too bad Vionic doesn't have enough fabric, or better fabric on the sole.
customer_reviews.author: Jputman

customer_reviews.title: Update After Treatment on feet
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to update this as I hadn't realized how badly my ankle and foot was when I purchased, I now find these to be a nice slipper and it doesn't cause foot pain from the hardness. If they hurt your feet it might be that there is something going on with the nerves and tendons that need to be addressed. Sure glad I didn't donate them. I find these heavy and very hard based, I read reviews on how people loved them but I'm not a fan, will donate.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: way to big for the average foot
customer_reviews.text: Both the internet hype and the reviews led me to believe these would be the perfect slipper. I suffer from heel pain. They are way to big for my average sized 7 1/2 foot. I even ordered a 7! Big, broad, bulky. These would never stay on my foot. Returning them.
customer_reviews.author: ski girl

customer_reviews.title: Great arch support well made .
customer_reviews.text: Love these slippers , I wear a size eight but in these I wear a size seven . They have a Velcro strap so you can adjust them to your width. High arch support, my go to house shoes . Well worth the money . They are not padded if you are looking for a soft slipper these are not it . Also they are not washable, but I have washed mine on gentle and let them air dry . The soles are hard so you can wear them outside .
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Not the right slippers for my feet
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning. The arch support did not hit my foot in the right spot. I wore them for about 2 hrs a day as suggested for the break in period. I really wanted to like these slippers but my feet hurt after wearing them. They sound like great slippers for some people just not me.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Slipper is completely different fit from leopard print bought 6 months ago
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as a replacement for my Mom’s leopard print pair which I bought 6 months ago. The same size just a different color but the fit was totally different. This is probably the fourth pair we’ve purchased and the fit was totally wrong - way too narrow! I’m disappointed because we had to return them and I really loved the support these slippers have and she wears her vionics every day.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: I love the footbed in this slipper
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I love the footbed in this slipper. This is my 3rd pair of Vionic; I previously ordered sandals. I love Vionic’s Arch support and the shoes are very comfortable. I would have given 5 stars but I want to address the size issue. Vionic says if you are a 1/2 size, to go down in size. I really think I should have ordered a size up. My toes are at the edge of the slipper, and if I wear socks with the slipper, it’s too small. Overall, I am a big fan of Vionic shoes!
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Relieve back pain
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from spondyliothesis and lower back pan, after the quarantine due to Corona virus, I found myself walking in a house with barefoot a lot, which resulted in more pain. I got these shoes, and the pain went away!!!! Good arch support. Would definitely get black. Have no idea how to wash it but so far so good!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Mok

customer_reviews.title: Great company!
customer_reviews.text: I truly love Vionic shoes. I ordered these slippers to use as summer slippers, so my feet wouldn't get too hot. I have closed toe Vionic slippers that I love and have had for a year and a half or so. When I tried these slippers on, the footbed on the right foot didn't feel right, and definitely not molded like the left footbed, or any of the other 4 pairs of Vionic shoes I own. I wore them on my carpet for about 15 minutes, and the pain in at foot was awful! I contacted Amazon and since, I have returned them, and reordered a new pair, with no questions asked. Just waiting for shipping, then... awesome comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Supermom

customer_reviews.title: VERY comfy!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE. I do not have foot issues, that is why I buy these, so I will not. I work from home so when you wear something A LOT it better be comfortable. Also, many colors not just three. Not sure about the wash-ability though . . . NEED to clean them sometime!!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Returned them
customer_reviews.text: I bought my size, the shoe had an inch too much shoe at the toe and behind my heel. It didn’t have arch support and the shoe had a hard bottom to it. Even if it had fit I would have returned it as it was too hard and uncomfortable without arch support.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was a bad pair, so I purchase another pair this year ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Orthaheel women relax slipper black show. I purchased a pair late 2016 and early 2018. My first pair material started to unravel. I thought it was a bad pair, so I purchase another pair this year and within 2 months it is doing the same thing!! I do wear them every day, but they look like I had them for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Great For Your Feet
customer_reviews.text: I have had a total knee replacement and also have a heel problem. I wear other Vionic sandals and love them so thought these would be good around the house. I'm so glad I bought them! They make my legs and feet feel great! My only request would be to use fabric instead of a fur in the footbed. They are very warm if you live in Florida. I wear a pair of thin socks with them which is a little cooler.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these hoping they would be my go to slippers to help me get through this bout of planters fasciitis. It helps but is not the answer I was looking for. Worked for a couple months, but already my heals are acting up. Good fit though. True to size. Good arch support. Just not enough Cush for my heals.
customer_reviews.author: G. Halverson

customer_reviews.title: Love Vionics!
customer_reviews.text: A savior for my achy feet! A friend introduced me to Vionics after having my first baby and spending 3 months at home walking around barefoot on hardwood or tile floors. My feet were killing me! So much that I wound up going to the podiatrist and getting a steroid shot in the bottom of my right foot. (Ouch!) i now wear my Vionic slippers at home all the time and my feet don’t bother me nearly as much!
customer_reviews.author: S. Robison

customer_reviews.title: Still Undecided
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to alleviate pain from the balls of my feet and toes. The arch support seems to do this. All the pressure is taken off the toes. The pain in my feet has remained the same though. Only time will tell. I think the choice of colors is not good.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 83yr old mother that has had some foot issues, her podiatrist told her not to wear house shoes that didn't have support. She said these were the most comfortable thing she has had on her feet in years, asked if she could be one of those old ladies that wears her house shoes everywhere? LOL ... I told her that was up to her, at 83 she had certainly earned that right!
customer_reviews.author: TJ

product_meta.title: Vibram FiveFingers Women's Bikila W Sneaker
product_meta.description: When we first introduced Vibram FiveFingers to the world, it was the beginning of a revolution
feature_bullets: Stretch Polyaminde Upper - designed for a superb glove-like fit, with TPU toe caps for protection and with padded collar and topline for great comfort
4mm Vibram TC-1 Rubber Outsole - designed anatomically to give the best protection where you need it most

3mm Polyurethane Footbed with Dri-Lex Sockliner - offers cushioning and comfort where you need it most. The footbed is also thickest under the ball of the foot where you will strike the ground when running in a more natural style
Single Hook and Loop Closure - helps pull the upper tight round the contours of your feet so it feels like a second skin
